1.text: Choose a mold that will hold water easily without spilling.

2.vid: /9/99/Make Ice Cubes Without a Tray Step 2.360p.mp4

3.text: Freeze the molds for at least 4-8 hours.

4.text: Pop the ice out by twisting the mold, just like an ice tray.
4.vid: /f/fc/Make Ice Cubes Without a Tray Step 4.360p.mp4

5.text: Fill a plastic zipper bag 1/4 full with water.
5.vid: /7/73/Make Ice Cubes Without a Tray Step 5.360p.mp4

6.text: Zip the bag shut to keep the water inside.
6.vid: /d/d3/Make Ice Cubes Without a Tray Step 6.360p.mp4

7.text: Lay the bag on its side in the freezer.
7.vid: /a/aa/Make Ice Cubes Without a Tray Step 7.360p.mp4

8.text: Freeze the water in the bag for 4-12 hours, depending on the amount of water.

9.text: Break up the ice after removing it.
9.vid: /7/73/Make Ice Cubes Without a Tray Step 9.360p.mp4

10.text: Choose a styrofoam egg carton for a simple, waterproof ice tray.

11.text: Line a paper carton with foil if you don’t have a styrofoam one.
11.vid: /9/9f/Make Ice Cubes Without a Tray Step 11.360p.mp4

12.vid: /b/bd/Make Ice Cubes Without a Tray Step 12.360p.mp4

13.text: Freeze the carton for at least 4-8 hours with the lid off.

14.text: Remove the ice from the carton by pressing up on the bottom.
14.vid: /7/72/Make Ice Cubes Without a Tray Step 14.360p.mp4
